column1: Requiem for the War on Drugs. Portuguese Experiences with Decriminalisation
Abstract
The evolution of the consumption and the control systems of drugs is widely different
among the countries. The same differences could be also found in the current experiences
of drug decriminalization. The author using historical and empirical data concerning the
“Portuguese Experimentation” argue that we are presently observing the end of “drug
war”. Can the drug consumption be regulated outside the penal law? This paper presents
an analysis of the data from the Portuguese experience that positively answers to that
question. In addition
column2: this analysis suggests that the decriminalization do not leads to an

column1: increase on public health problems and crime.
